descriptions: Does not identify any symptoms that would prompt seeking health care.
Identifies only one symptom, but it is vague or not clearly linked to a need for health care.
Identifies a few common symptoms (2-3) that might warrant seeking health care, but lacks detail or accuracy.
Identifies several common symptoms (3-4) that should prompt seeking health care with reasonable accuracy.
Identifies most common symptoms (4-5) accurately and provides some context for when to seek care.
Thoroughly identifies numerous common symptoms and provides a comprehensive understanding of when and why individuals should seek health care, including specific examples.
Demonstrates no understanding of the severity or urgency of symptoms.
Shows minimal awareness of the importance of seeking timely health care.
Demonstrates some understanding of the need to seek care for certain symptoms, but struggles to differentiate between urgent and non-urgent situations.
Understands the need to seek timely care and generally differentiates between urgent and non-urgent symptoms.
Clearly understands the severity and urgency of various symptoms, accurately distinguishing between conditions requiring immediate attention and those that can be monitored.

Exhibits a nuanced understanding of the spectrum of symptom severity, providing comprehensive insights into appropriate response times and levels of care needed based on specific symptom presentation.
Unable to apply knowledge to real-life scenarios.
Struggles to apply knowledge of symptoms to practical situations.
Can identify symptoms in basic scenarios but has difficulty with complex or nuanced situations.
Can apply knowledge to a variety of real-life scenarios with reasonable accuracy.
Confidently applies knowledge to a wide range of scenarios, demonstrating an ability to assess situations and make informed decisions about seeking health care.

Masterfully applies knowledge to complex, real-life scenarios, offering insightful and well-reasoned recommendations for seeking appropriate health care, demonstrating critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
